mehisubus.jcr:title: Buffalo Plaid Shorts
mehisubus.features:
• Polyester and spandex blend offers stretch for comfort
  • Side hand pockets and a rear zippered pocket provide plenty of places to stash the small things you require traveling
  • Drawstring at the waist provides a comfortable, personalized fit
mehisubus.reviews:
By stowe.perry from Greenville, SC
So far I've worn these shorts to play Ultimate and Basketball. There is just enough stretch to allow free movement. The shorts also wick very quickly. I live in South Carolina at the moment and it is very humid here. Usually when I wear shorts or anything stretching they are so wet it feels like I just jumped out of a pool. These shorts stayed pretty dry and allowed me to wipe my hands like they were a towel. Pockets are also nice to have. There is a zipper pocket in the back which is great when you're at the beach and need a place to put your key. The shorts seem durable and I'm not scared they are going to rip. The fabric is also very lightweight.
mehisubus.summary: The Buffalo Shorts are stylish yet versatile warm-weather gear that will save you space in your luggage.

mehisucos.jcr:title: Corona Shorts
mehisucos.features:
• Lightweight peached nylon fabric wicks moisture and dries quickly to keep you comfortable on the go; fabric has a soft, smooth feel
  • With a UPF 50+ rating, fabric provides excellent protection against harmful ultraviolet rays
  • Secure your travel and trail essentials in the 2 side-seam zippered pockets or side cargo pockets
mehisucos.reviews:
By YearAroundTheWorld from Florida
These shorts rock! I use them all the time for travel and everyday use, as swimming trunks too. Lightweight, but not so flimsy that they bunch up easy or feel strange like some other brands. They air dry very fast too.
The best part about them is that they look great, you don't look like a gear-nerd with elastic waistbands, mesh panels, huge logos, etc.
I own an older version of them, as well as this new version. This updated style has been improved with larger thigh pockets, better zippers, and zippered back pockets instead of buttons. All were changes that I love.
By srd123 from Seattle, WA
I have three pairs of these shorts. They're great except for the zippers. The zipper pulls have broken on all three pairs. 1 pair- both pockets and the fly; 1 pair- both pockets; and 1 pair- one pocket.
mehisucos.summary: Corona shorts offer quick-drying convenience and travel-savvy details that are a perfect match for active lifestyles

mehisulat.jcr:title: Laguna Short-Sleeve Shirt
mehisulat.features:
• Blend of recycled polyester and organic cotton delivers comfort and style that you can feel good about
  • Contrasting stitch details add appeal
  • Chest pockets stash essentials
mehisulat.reviews: This item is not yet rated. Be the first to write a review.
mehisulat.summary: Don't sacrifice function for style. The Laguna is perfect for adventures at home or in the great outdoors.

mehisusls.jcr:title: Slot Canyon Active Shorts
mehisusls.features:
• Lightweight nylon fabric dries quickly, resists pilling and is easy to pack away in a backpack
  • With a UPF 50+ rating, fabric provides excellent protection against harmful ultraviolet rays
  • Fabric is treated with a Durable Water Repellent? finish to repel moisture and stains
  • Included webbing belt can be completely removed if desired; waist features a snap and a zippered fly
mehisusls.reviews:
By Avid Hiker from Maryland
I have many pairs of the previous version of the Slot Canyon Short, but won't be buying any of these. I use them for hiking, and hiking shorts shouldn't have such long legs. I don't care for the changes to the pockets either. Please change back!
By Msmity from Nashville, Tn
I have five pairs of the older model of this short and they are amazing. Probably the best shorts I have ever owned. I went to get some more when I had worn out some of them and they had a new model. I thought surely this will only be better. I was very wrong the new design is horrible. They are too long, don't tighten well with new belt, no hidden pocket(best feature in older model), and no zipper on cargo pocket. I was very disappointed and will never buy another pair until they return to the older model.
mehisusls.summary: With multiple pockets for stowing must-have items, the lightweight Slot Canyon Active Shorts bring comfort and convenience to your hiking and traveling adventures.

mehisusts.jcr:title: Stretch Fatigue Shorts
mehisusts.features:
• Nylon fabric has just a touch of spandex for comfortable stretch and is also quick drying
  • Generous cargo pockets
  • Ventilated inseam gusset and mesh pocket material combine to make shorts that breathe extremely well
  • Streamlined adjustable waistband for a comfortable, personalized fit
mehisusts.reviews:
By WestIsBEST from Tempe, AZ
Very comfy, easily adjustable waist, sit well even under a backpack's waist belt all day. Not that I'd wear them for soccer, but the touch of stretch means you have easy movement for hiking etc. Fast drying, good looking. Lightweight but appear to be quite durable. All the little details like pocket positioning, vents, reinforced stitching, soft lining at waist = excellent. Only downside was a couple of loose stitch ends I snipped off when I bought them, but nothing unraveled or otherwise appears amiss. Impressive product, very pleased with these shorts and so went back bought the pants too.
mehisusts.summary: Be comfortable no matter where you are climbing a rock wall, riding a bus in the Andes or just chilling with your friends at a backyard barbecue.

mehisutrs.jcr:title: Trail Model Pants
mehisutrs.features:
• Nylon/spandex fabric resists abrasion and has an all-weather finish to help shed moisture; fabric dries quickly when wet
  • Double-thick panels on the knees and rear hem ensure long-lasting wear in the outdoors
  • Feature 2 front hand pockets and 2 rear pockets (right rear pocket has a flap for added security); zippered cargo pocket on the left secures trail essentials
  • Pant legs roll up and secure in place with snaps
mehisutrs.reviews:
By Pete2599 from Central, CA
These pants are incredible for all-around use. I've traveled, camped, and hiked in them. The roll up leg is a real plus for warmer weather, but they're so breathable, it's hardly necessary. Dressy enough for heading into town. They last forever! I purchased a second pair years ago and they're still waiting in the closet - my first pair remain in great condition!
mehisutrs.summary: The Trail Model Pants to the test on your next climbing trip, trail hike or globe-trotting adventure.

mehiwible.jcr:title: Black Sheep Natural Wool Beanie
mehiwible.features: • Merino wool wicks away moisture and breathes to regulate temperature for outstanding comfort in a variety of conditions
mehiwible.reviews:
By TFG1067 from Los Angeles, CA
i love this beanie. i wear it all year round. it actually breathes really well in the warmer months, and keeps your head warm down to the high 40's. of course, i live in southern CA so it doesn't get very cold here, but i spent 3 weeks this summer in 6 different national parks with this beanie and it worked wonderfully. if you're looking for something to keep you warm in the snow, i would probably wear something windproof over this, or buy a different product
mehiwible.summary: Soft and light, this smart-looking hand knit beanie provides the soft feel and easy warmth of merino wool without the itch and smell of wool.

mehiwiedt.jcr:title: Eddie Hat
mehiwiedt.features:
• Waterproof poly outer shell
  • Warm faux-fur lining
mehiwiedt.reviews:
By Triathlete Surfer from Carlsbad, CA
returned it. the hat is too lightweight. i bought it because i liked the style, but i also wanted a hat that would protect my head from the cold. this hat is not as warm as it looks, despite the lining.
mehiwiedt.summary: The Eddie Hat offers warmth and old-school style for adventures in the woods or in your own backyard.

mehiwiext.jcr:title: Expedition Tech Long-Sleeved Shirt
mehiwiext.features:
• Lightweight nylon fabric wicks moisture, dries quickly and breathes easily for great comfort
  • Integrated mesh ventilation at the back yoke and under the arms helps keep you cool while traveling in warm climates
  • Cargo-style chest pockets provide ample space for travel essentials
  • Button-close chest pockets keep small items secure
mehiwiext.reviews:
By 1975Hiker from Monterey, CA I bought this shirt for backpacking mainly. It is light and dries fairly quickly. Pockets are handy but the sleeves are a little bit short.
By Dynasty301 from North Carolina I took this shirt in the green color on a 3 month bike tour and like it a lot. It's very lightweight, packs small, and dries quickly. For a "tall" it could actually be a bit taller, but it's reasonable and I always wear the sleeves rolled up part way anyways.
mehiwiext.summary: High tech fabric means you can stay comfortable wherever you go, from the desert to the tropics to alpine terrain.
